page.title: 05Erosion on the River Caldew
page.content: The River Caldew is a river behind the two Dalston schools.People in Caldew school are worried because sooner or later the tennis courts might disappear.They're for major places of erosion.200 yards (1 yard=0.9144 metres) from the White bridge there is a bank which people jump down and skid down the banks to the river.Very near the White bridge they had a digger to dig out all the stones from the river bed.Where the old mill stream there is a tree hanging over an island now the erosion is so bad they have to block off the tree with wire fencing.The tree would{probably help stop the {erosion}.If you walk down the stream to a triangular section of the river bank,downstream 100 yards there is another major point of erosion.It is so bad that they had to double fence it away from the major path.
